授業目的: This course stresses Japan's financial system with a particular reference to corporate finance. The course will review the features of Japan's financial system, financial institutions, and financial markets to ensure effective financial intermediation as well as robustness in the financial system. Also, the course will highlight the functions of the Tokyo Stock Exchange, the Bank of Japan, the Financial Services Agency, and the banking system for efficiently deploying funds to entrepreneurs. Finally, the course will shed light on determining interest rates, the time value of money, and Japan's foreign exchange transactions.
到達目標: After completing the course, students will learn the features of the Japanese financial system, financial institutions, financial markets, and financial instruments in providing corporate finance. The course is helpful for advanced corporate finance and financial management electives.  The course is helpful for students who intend to build a career as an investment banker.
関連科目: Introductory courses on accounting, finance, and economics
授業の概要・背景: Not required
授業方法: This course will be offered in a face-to-face format. Course pedagogy includes lectures, articles, and case studies to illustrate and reinforce concepts. Students are expected to have read assigned materials before attending each class. The instructor will supply all the reading materials in advance. Before the first class, the instructor will send students the lecture power points and reading materials.
